titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Reference Files
1907-2015 (bulk 1933-2003)
MS 3009-RG 3
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Melanie Rinehart, Samantha Brown, and Holly Deakyne
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-05T09:59-0500

did.abstract: The Time Inc. Reference Files document the the history of Time Inc. through overviews or historical summaries of various divisions and franchises. This record group originally may have been Time Inc.’s “central file.” Materials include press releases; handbooks and manuals; runs of employee newsletters; seventy years of staff-wide memos; and lists of department heads, correspondents, contributors, and subsidiaries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Reference Files (MS 3009-RG 3), The New-York Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Time Inc. Reference Files document the history of various Time Inc. divisions such as the editing and publishing groups for the major titles, Circulation, various office locations, and Public Affairs; franchises such as the Sports Illustrated "Swimsuit Issue" and Time "Person of the Year" (originally "Man of the Year"); and staff organizations. Materials include press releases; handbooks and manuals; runs of employee newsletters and in-house organs, such as FYI and Keywords; seventy years of staff-wide memos; and lists of department heads, correspondents, contributors, and subsidiaries.

While the Reference Files seem to serve a similar purpose to the Time Inc. Subject Files, this record group may have, at one point, been organically created by departments sending copies of informative records to Time Inc.’s “central file.” It isn’t clear which department had ownership of that file or who was allowed to access it. The creation of Reference Files or the central file may have changed over time.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include privileged attorney correspondence; student records; medical records; personnel performance evaluations; contracts and agreements; and records with personally identifiable information. Unreformatted audiovisual material and digital material in the collection is not accessible. Restricted materials are located in box R6. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The Time Inc. Reference Files were processed by Melanie Rinehart, Samantha Brown, and Holly Deakyne in 2016. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Melanie Rinehart and Samantha Brown created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized alphabetically based on Time Inc.'s original arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: FYI is an internal Time Inc. staff newsletter. The index cards are organized by staff members' last names and indexes mentions within the printed issues. In 2002, Time Inc. began distributing the newsletter online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The final issue as i.e. was published November/December 1997. This newsletter was renamed TWX as of January 1998.
